isis.stitle: SPICER 14 INCH (350 MM) SOLO CLUTCH - RESETTING PROCEDURES - CLUTCH ASSEMBLY IN VEHICLE

svcproc.title: CLUTCH ASSEMBLY IN VEHICLE
svcproc.para: An improperly set clutch will result in poor release complaints. To verify correct clutch release, place a dial indicator on one of the pressure plate limiters ( Figure 35) and depress the clutch pedal. Single plate clutch assemblies will indicate .035 inch movement. Two plate clutch assemblies will indicate .055 inch movement. Before proceeding with this procedure, verify clutch release bearing travel is a minimum of .500 inch; if not, the clutch linkage must be adjusted. Refer to GROUP 11 - CLUTCH LINKAGE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the model being serviced.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Place Dial Indicator on Pressure Plate Limiter

step1.para: Depress clutch pedal and move the wear indicator tab to the new position ( Figure 34). Release the clutch pedal.
Install and tighten four (4) shipping bolts hand tight.
Alternately tighten each shipping bolt 2 full turns to reset the pressure plate limiters.
Alternately remove the four (4) shipping bolts.
Depress the clutch pedal 5 times to reset the clutch.
